Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: vogensen
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed in the All Seasons for four nights during the Carnival break in February. I chose it because of its belonging to the Accor group, which I find quite dependable and good value for money. From the airport we took the Connexion shuttle, which for some strange reason, cannot pick you up at the same hotel on your departure. They can drop you off but can't pick you up. Even the driver didn't know why. Anyway, about the hotel. Our first night was spent in one of the tiniest rooms I have ever seen on the ground floor. There wasn't even room to put our suitcase on the floor. This wasn't a last minute checkin either, having booked months ahead. Other rooms were available but the man at the desk deemed it logical to put us in the smallest room in the hotel. The next morning, chatting to the girl at reception, who was very friendly, we mentioned where we were. She was shocked to find out we were in that cubbyhole and immediately moved us to decent quarters. This new room was perfect and totally adequate for our needs. There was no noise from the street below. In the room there is an appliance for heating water and plenty of tea and instant coffee envelopes. The television was plasma and on the wall facing the bed. Breakfast, included in the rate, was excellent with plenty of variety. There were several types of croissant, cold cereals including muesli, yogurts, a variety of jams, even eggs and bacon. The best part was the coffee machine, which produced a delicious capuccino. The women working at breakfast seemed to be Filipino or Malasian and were always very outgoing and friendly, greeting everyone and asking if we wanted anything else. All in all, I would say that the hotel staff was well trained to satisfy the customer's needs. As far as location goes, the hotel is in a quiet area, closer to the Museum Quarter than the central train station, but only a few minutes walk to the tram stop. The Van Gogh Museum is 1.5 kilometers away and walking slowly (12 minutes a kilometer) it would take you 18 minutes. A Lidl supermarket is a few meters away to the east on Stadhouderskade and on the large avenue to the west, the Van Wouststraat, there are seemingly non-stop ethnic restaurants, mainly of an Oriental persuasion. There is a cash machine in front of the Roots restaurant, at Stadhouderskade 123. Sadly I did not encounter any bedbugs or perhaps they didn't find my blood enticing. In conclusion, considering that lodging is very expensive in Amsterdam, I would definitely recommend the All Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs nightmare”
Reviews.Author: roger d
Reviews.Content: I booked this room in march 2012, sadly I did not read trip advisor prior reviews, trusting that as the hotel is part of the ACCOR group (sofitel and co), this hotel would be clean. What a mistake!!! they are infested with bed bugs! The management is totally irresponsible and is renting the rooms although completely aware of the problem. I woke up in the morning discovering a few bed bugs in my bed and mentionned it to the management who were in denial and tried to undermine the situation. The nighmare started a few days later: I was covered head to toes with hundred bites. These things are nasty and difficult to get rid of. So, considering the following other reviews (see below), I would recommend that you avoid this place like hell. http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g188590-d593689-r103744903-Seasons_Hotel_Amsterdam-Amsterdam_Noord_Holland.html#CHECK_RATES_CONT http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g188590-d593689-r46156269-Seasons_Hotel_Amsterdam-Amsterdam_Noord_Holland.html#CHECK_RATES_CONT

Reviews.Title: “OK"”
Reviews.Author: StaffsLass66
Reviews.Content: ,Excellent location for Trams into centre Amsterdam. Clean Hotel, Linen changed Daily. Strange Bedroom layout, watch out for high step into Bath.Adequate Breakfast if somewhat repetative.Avoid rooms on same floor as reception and below ground level we did experience one sleepless night because of noise. We would stay here again but request rooms on higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrie1-12
Reviews.Content: this hotel was perfect. The room wasn't huge, but it was very reasonably priced and very clean, and warm. The breakfast was nice, buffet style, with breads, cereals, meat, cheese etc. There was a sandwich toaster for you to make your own toasties too. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room was at the front of the hotel, overlooking a canal. We did not find it at all noisy (we visited in february ). Central enough, we got a taxi (organised by the hotel) from the hotel to the airport, took about 25 minutes and cost about â‚¬40. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small double room”
Reviews.Author: TravellerInAsia2011
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for 5 days in a double room. The room was very small and very annoying. The location was good and very close to the tram. The staff was kind and the breakfast was good. So the bad point is about the room, but for sure I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: manchestert15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at this hotel just for 3 nights Jan 9th ,the hotel seemed very clean and friendly,price was good and breakfast was included. All the staff seemed friendly and helpful and on are last day we was allowed to leave are luggage free of charge, free internet was also available if needed. The hotel wasnt that far away from the center and easy acces was fine buses and metero are quite close by, there are also lots of shops and restaraunts just around the corner also a market . I would reccomend this hotel to my friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Can Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Ben N Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is acceptable but I hope that they can improve the housekeeping and breakfast table. The housekeeping did change the towels and make beds daily. However I do not understand why they did not change the floor towel. For four nights stay, it was not change at all. I agrees with other comments on this website, after the second morning, I have enough of the breakfast. I would like to see some variation on the menu. It would be nice. My compliments to the two ladies at the reception. They were excellent and very helpful. Because of their actions, it helps in the overall stay well. Having said the above, I would still recommend my friends to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location, but outstanding value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The price which included breakfast and wifi was for Amsterdam outstanding. I would stay stay here again. Only down side was that it wasn't in the centre, but the cost of a tram / metro is nothing compared to the savings by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “nice city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: l liked AMS its realy nice city, i hope i visit again, the hotel was not bad (Fair) and the place is good. The room is good but ther is some noise you can hear from outside. The reception is bad actuly and the corredors of the hotel are small , The service is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “very tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: pratik06
Reviews.Content: location of the hotel is good... easy access by tram to the central area.... rooms are very small and very noisy.... give you a hostel feeling.... bathroom is similar size to what you will find in cruise liners... very very small and crammed.. found it very pricey...

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, but great value”
Reviews.Author: evelynecwhite Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on ease of access to Centraal Station and the RAI Europaplein. It's a 1 minute walk from the #4 tram which goes from Centraal to Europaplein. I also chose it because the price was reasonable and I was pleased with the value for money. Other hotels with similarl ammenities cost twice as much, merely because they're a few stops closer to the center. The All Seasons is still is in a nice location, just across from a canal - my room had a balcony overlooking the canal. A great restaurant called the Roots is just on the corner, and there are plenty of fast food places and convenience stores within walking distance. The downsides were: small room (seems to be the case everywhere in Amsterdam), very basic bathroom w/ small shower (no bath), strange/old hairdryer that doesn't really work + poor lighting in the bedroom. None of these factors are all that important to me, so I'd stay there again (and this time bring my own hair dryer).

Reviews.Title: “normal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A normal hotel, for me this is the average for a business stay. not to fancy, no cheap stuff. just as it should. comfy and nice. clean big rooms with a relatively big bathroom with clean a clean shower. 3 minutes walk from the Metro and 10 minutes walk from the Amsterdam centre.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: EMT999
Reviews.Content: we stayed at t All seasons hotel for a weekend. The hotel is nice and clean and has free wifi. It took 20 minutes to walk to Rembrants square, 30 minutes to red light district and china town. There is no on street parking but a small garage for 4/5 cars around back of hotel at 10 euros per night extra. I would try a cheaper hotel next time as dont feel this one was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Rodney K
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped off the tram from Central we knew we'd made a mistake. Maybe our expectations are too high but after reading other traveller reviews we thought this hotel would be good and suit our needs. The entrance was unappealing and the reception small and in need of a revamp. Our greeting was warm to say the least but apart from that overall the staff were fine. As most of the other reviews have already said the lift would have to be one of the slowest around and as we were on the second floor we found it quicker to use the stairs most of the time. The room was small... too small and didn't smell very nice upon entering. We had a balcony which was nice but it overlooked a main road which was quite noisy. The breakfast was ordinary and if it wasn't included in the price you wouldn't bother. They didn't even have a toaster, you had to use a jaffel maker to toast your bread. On our thrid morning the hot food ran out before the breakfast was due to end or they just took it away. Ordinarily we would have said something but we figured they were doing us a favour. The worst think was the location... too far out for walking unless you like walking a lot. This was more our fault for relying on other peoples reviews. If you used the tram it maybe okay but do youself a favour and get something closer in. Not horrible but certain;y not good.

Reviews.Title: “Fab base for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Alpal21
Reviews.Content: Arrived late the night the Netherlands lost to Spain in the world cup ( review would only let me go back as far as august) to a sea off orange people trying to leave Amsterdam. Spent a couple of hours trying to get a taxi but ended up walking most of the way and didn't arrive at hotel until 3am to be greeted by very friendly staff. Had a basement family room for two rooms were clean and comfortable as was the hotel. Stayed a week and was moved to a smaller room after 2 days ( no probe for us) very friendly staff and breakfast was good with lots of variety. Plenty to see and do and with shops around the corner you really feel as though you are living with the locals.. I must recommend the Thai resteraunt just around the corner in Van Woustraat prices for hotel were good but go up on weekends so we haggled for a weekly rate and were given it. Fab people Fab place will be back in 2012 for more of the Dutch life

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in Amsterdam center.”
Reviews.Author: cdelsolar
Reviews.Content: No AIR CONDITIONING!!!!! Traffic all night long. HarÃ© to sleep. The sheets on my bed had a blood stain!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, definately.”
Reviews.Author: sezjay-11
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my boyfriend and i had been to Amsterdam together, and this hotel was excellent. The breakfast was a little basic, but no more so than any other european breakfast anywhere else! The room was immaculate, room 106, bathroom very equiped and modern, very cool and comfortable, rooms made up daily, plenty of space for a city break stay. All in all would stay again, was a little out of the centre, but right next to the very frequent tram stop, which buying a 24hr pass saves loads to go up and down all day. Would definately stay again, and cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug central!”
Reviews.Author: Nataliecdavies
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in May and although we found it pleasant enough and in a good location, we took back home with us some unexpected visitors; namely, bedbugs. Our holiday has cost me an extra Â£150 to get rid of the bedbugs from room 407 that have travelled back with us and I have spent a week of cleaning, fumagating and smoke bombs attempting to exterminate the bedbugs. Oh and not to mention the regular itchy and unsightly bites that my boyfriend and I are enduring. Thank you Hotel Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Generally OK, there are others!!”
Reviews.Author: Canary29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is generally OK. The room was tidy enough, clean and the bathroom looked recently refitted. The Wi-FI didn't work but you can actually pick up on an unsecure connection from elsewhere. Good value for money and a good location. I was happy there on my own, but if I was to take my girlfriend I would like somewhere different with a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a first visit to Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: filmwilliams
Reviews.Content: We'd never been to Amsterdam before and after doing a lot of googling I decided on this hotel as it seemed to be within easy reach of everywhere we wanted to visit and good value for half term week. The first great thing I would say is that we expected to be getting trams everywhere but in fact we never got a single one! If you are a speedy walker like me and my boyf you will find you can walk pretty much everywhere in Amsterdam. If you like to stroll you'll probably be better on a tram, although Rembrandt Plein is really close for great food and drink (The Old Bell). The Hotel has a big staff team and they are all very welcoming and speak good English. We arrived from the airport at about 10am and although check-in isn't until 2pm the guy on reception let us have our room straight away. Also note you have to pay city tax on arrival (ours was â‚¬9 for 4 nights). Our room was on the 4th floor, right next to the lift (slowest lift in the world but makes hilarious noises) which is a welcome alternative to the steep wooden stairs - although we never really had any problems with noise in the room. Room 406 was quite small but perfect for our 4 night stay, with twin beds pushed together, a safe, tea and coffee making facilities, shower, plenty of storage and 3 mirrors! The only downside was that the hairdryer in the room was strange looking and difficult to use, I've added a picture 'cos I don't think my descriptions will do it justice - I recommend taking your own if you need to use it every day. Daily room service is a nice bonus, making the beds and leaving fresh towels, but unfortunately never cleaning the teacups and spoons. Breakfast is GREAT, as a girl who likes their food I was not disappointed. Tuck in! YUM! Another thing, we got a return train ticket but we did notice that the hotel does a shuttle to the airport for â‚¬12 which is VERY good. Finally, we found a quite sizeable supermarket 5 mins away, across the bridge L out of hotel and under the right of the AEGON building sign :) they sell a 6 pack of Heineken for â‚¬3.60!! and snacks of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great! And so near to everything!”
Reviews.Author: TheLittleEstonian
Reviews.Content: We decided to go for a couple days in Amsterdam in the beginning of February, and looking for a hotel we found this good quality hotel for a very reasonable price. The hotel was in a nice area, about a 15 minute walk to both city centre (Rembrandt Square, Dam Square), 20 minutes walk to the Red Light District and around 15 minutes to the Van Gogh museum. For the lazier ones there is also 2 trams connecting the hotel to the centre! Parking is available at the hotel, which is pretty much a luxury in the central Amsterdam area. It was for an additional fee of 25EUR per day. Sundays parking on the street is free though! The room itself was basic, but nice. Comfy beds. Smaller bathrooms, but more than enough for a short break. We did have some problems with the heating, but it was fixed right away, when notified. The reception staff was always very helpful, when trying to find local information. They do serve breakfast at the hotel, but we never opted to it, decided to go to town instead. All in all, was very happy with the whole stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a long weekend in the 'Dam”
Reviews.Author: kittyandkids
Reviews.Content: Seasons Hotel is a brilliant bargain for a long weekend away. Location: Slightly out of the city centre to the South East, this hotel is roughly a 20 minute walk into town with plenty of nice restaurants etc on the way in. Taxi wise it's about 10euro from the station. Quiet, clean area in walking distance of all the major museums etc. Food: The price includes a decent breakfast with normal continental breakfast and complete with traditional toastie maker! Staff: really friendly & professional. Rooms: mega clean, if compact. Flat screen plasma tellies in each room, tea/coffee etc and warm rooms. Downsides: only downside would be the alarm which went off each morning we were there for a few seconds, not sure what this was as wasn't a major problem.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a mixed bag, but generally ok”
Reviews.Author: Me_n_my_rucksack
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam during the extreem cold spell at the end of 2010 and booked this hotel at the last moment, getting a reasonable price. The club is handy for trams and a 10 mins walk from a Metro ststion. Although we had searched for a hotel which offered free breakfast, and the hotel ad promised complimentary breakfast with all rooms, we were informed that our booking did not attract a free breakfast as we had got a special rate. Breakfast was 7.5 euros each. We found better breakfasts for slightly less at a local cafe as it happened. We subsiuently complained to booking.com and got a 25 euro rebate for 2 days. This may not be the hotels fault - never got to the bottom of it. The stairs, in common I would imagine with most Amsterdam economy hotels, are very steep. There is however a lift. The rooms were basic yet comfortable. Tea coffee ( one sachet each per day mind) facillities in the room. We had a room at the back of the hotel which may have been smaller than those at the front. Good quality wall mounted TV had lots of international channels including BBC1 and worked very well. The bathroom was very small but the bath very large, deep and the plumbing worked very very well. All in all the bathroom, bath and nice complimentary smellies were of a high standard. There is no free wifi. When we wanted to use the hotel internet for the min 30 mins at something like 2 or 3 euros to check our flights we were told that there were no "tickets" or "password tickets" for that amount. However there were tickets for larger periods of time - at a consumate larger cost. We asked the receptionist if they could check our flight status ( there was huge disruption due to snow) and after a token effort they declared they could not get on the Schippol website. It could well be that the password printer was problematic but even then the wifi / internet access was pricey. The receptionist on duty when we arrived was v friendly, however we never saw her again and there was a constant change of staff - some cheerfull and some less so. All had v good English. The most contentious aspect of the hotel was that we are reasonably sure we had a bedbug in the sheets. We had no idea what bedbugs look like but on returning home googled them and are reasonably sure the little blighter we saw was a bed bug. Bit like a small apple seed, which moves about a bit. However in summary the hotel was reasonably priced and reasonably comfortable. There are probably worse hotels out there, but due to the various however if staying in Amsterdam again Id try somewhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Average, clean, modern, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Ben-aus-Rostock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located quite central in Amsterdam, just 15 min walk to Rembrandt square. The tram-station is just outside and it's 15 min to the RAI-conference center or 10 min to Dam-square/ the city center. The street Standhouderskate is one of the main roads circling the city center and this is obvious during the week days due to high and noisy traffic. The hotel has about 45 rooms, and my collegues and I got the three rooms on the ground floor, directly facing the lobby. which means, everybody passes by, taking the wooden stairs or the elevator - not to mention the breakfast room which is also just besides the lobby. The room had a big window with a sliding door, which could be opened completely or shut, but nothing in between - quite advanturous during the night if you want to sleep with an open window, because the room once was the entry hall of the side building (both buildings were put togehter for the hotel), so it had stairs down to the road just outside the window: an open invitation during the night?! I thought they were kidding me. The other rooms hat "normal" windows. The staff was friendly and helpful, the small room was really clean and furnished quite modern with LCD-TV and many international channels. The bathroom was about 1 sqm big, but had a big shower, but the WC was in a corner so that only people with short legs could sit there comfortably. The WIFI internet is bookable for 2 euro/30 min. in the lobby you also could use the PC for the same price. The breakfast was simple, with 3 types of white bread or croissant, scrambled or boiled eggs, soft coffey, 3 types of tetrapak juices, 2 types of packed jam and peanut butter, cheese, ham, salami and some vegetables. single prize for 9 euro if you don't book it with the room. in summary: the prices of 130 euro for a double and 100 for a single (beginning of july) are way too high. maybe the rooms in the upper floors facing backwards are alright but you also could get the rooms in the basement!

Reviews.Title: “A good base to explore Amsterdam from”
Reviews.Author: AlexNLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: we found the hotel a good base to explore Amsterdam from although a little far out there was a tram stop at the end of the street the trams ran every 10 minutes so you never had to wait very long the rooms although basic were very clean with tea & coffee making facilities the bathroom was on the small side although again clean the breakfast room was bright and airy the food was plentiful the staff were polite we recommend you buy a 24/48hr travel pass that enables you to use the trams,buses and some boats unlimited for 7euro per day we found this good value,very efficiant and on time the train station from the hotel is approx 20mins.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: tanabanana87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night only because the hotel we booked was overbooked and they transferred us to this hotel. The staff were very nice and helpful, as we have a toddler they sorted us out with a travel cot. The hotel is convenient to the Heineken museum and some very nice places to eat, so is quite central. A bit pricey for what you get in my opinion, but if you get a good deal then you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “As comfortably as staying home”
Reviews.Author: Clifton73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were lucky to visit Amsterdam last week when it was very nice weather. And staying at this hotel made our trip perfect. It was very comfortable to sleep there, plus we got a room which was very quiet at night. The reception staff, no matter day shift or evening shift were very friendly and gave us a lot of information about city. The hotel is very close to the museum district. Within 10 minutes on foot we reach the famous Van Gogh Museum as well as National Museum. The tram stop is in front of the hotel, from where we can get city center in less than 10 minutes. The breakfast we had at the hotel was pretty like what we eat everyday at home, with more choices of corn flakes and jams. I booked several weeks before arrival when the Hot Deal was still available, which made quality-price even higher. We will definitely stay at this hotel again next time we visit Amsterdam and suggest it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Total ripoff”
Reviews.Author: nomaadic13
Reviews.Content: I know it was a busy weekend due to a conference but paying 1200$cdn for two nights for such a crappy place was a real trip killer. I'm glad we only stayed 2 nights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Clean Hotel, but Inconvenient in Every Aspect”
Reviews.Author: mfreund72
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam and had a three night stay. Was there on business and I have been to Amsterdam many times before. Found the hotel to be clean and cheap, but everything else was a huge inconvenience. No AC, was very loud and couldnt sleep, not central and a lengthier than usual walk to eat or central points. Wireless was a pain as you had to purchase pre-paid cards with login/passwords that ran out and disconnected you. No iron or board. Breakfast was nothing special. Overall, I have stayed at nicer places and will not return... for business or pleasure. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The only mirror in the room was so high I never saw below my collar bone”
Reviews.Author: TroubledTraveler
Reviews.Content: Of course my friend who is shorter then I at like 5'4" needed to stand on her toes to do her hair and make up in the moring. Now I'm not a vain person but I consider it a public service to give myself the once over before inflicting myself on the world ... not an option at this hotel. Also, guests here should be warned, if you arrive the week before universtiy starts and have a "quiet" room at the back of the hotel, at 2 am every night you'll be entertained by chanting, marching, shouting and singing, there is a frat house immediately behind the hotel and a women's house about 500 meters down the street from it. (The call and response at 2:15 am the morning of my presentation was really amazing). The other thing to keep in mind is that not all rooms in this hotel are the same...I had 2 friends who were placed in a basement room with no ventaliation and that smelled like cat urine. Another friend was in an "authentic" Amsterdam room, with a sloped ceiling so that in the shower she had to bend at the waist to get her head under the water (she's only about 5'5"). The room I stayed, clearly the best of the lot had two single beds (very low, very hard, it reminded me of the beds you have on a carribean cruise - without any of the fun cruise stuff). Also, I found it odd -but it may just be European, that there were no sheets...I was never sure how clean things were. There was a basic breakfast avail every day, nothing fancy but certainly enough to fill up on. The staff were really hit or miss, there seemed to be only ONE person at the desk who actually liked working with the public and guests. Everyone else seemed pretty put out when you asked for basic information (like how to get a tram card) and typically gave poor information (like take the tram to central station to buy the tram card --when you could walk 1/2 block down to the grocery store and get the same thing). Finally, and this is a big one, they clearly set up their web page and ads to suggest that you will have free internet at this hotel (one of the reasons we chose it)...they do NOT. This is an added fee.

Reviews.Title: “Keep away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viaggiatore74Pavia
Reviews.Content: Terrible. The rooms were dirty and also the service was inefficient. We past three night. We past the first night in a room in front of the reception with a terrible smell coming from the bath, the air in the bathroom was unbreathable. We asked if was possible to change immediately the room, but only the day after we changed. In the second room we didn't find any bad smell, but the sheets were dirty, seemed blood, and in the shower worked only the hot water, so we took a shower risking to burn. I asked at the reception changing the sheets, but because there weren't anyone personal service I had to change by myself the sheets (also the new sheets were dirty one of them had big yellow stains). The day after to conclude our experience, we found the room without the towels. We asked them at the reception and they gave us only two little towels (one dirty), because they told me "Other room had the same problems, we didn't have other towelsâ€�. You could consider by yourself the quality of this hotel. The position however was good, close to the center of the city. Also the breakfast was rich.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient, clean, quiet, central location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: samirbud
Reviews.Content: this is a beautiful place, the hotel is cheep, good breakfast inculded into price, good size of bathroom with bath and shower, very clean, comfortable beds with good quality bedding, big windows which we opened into a green and quiet courtyard the hotel is couple of tram stops from the centre, near the canal

Reviews.Title: “Nice one”
Reviews.Author: LOLANetherlands
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Seasons hotel for 4 nights and we definitely enjoyed it. The rooms are clean and have been recently renovated, nice bathroom,flat screen TV,nice front of house staff, the chambermaids came everyday and the place was spotless. The location is so so, if you know amsterdam well like we do it wasnt hard to walk a bit and find attractions but it might put people off. If you wanna be in the red light district, this place isn t for you. The breakfast was OK, no frills here. And we ended up paying 60 quid a night which is very very cheap in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, location pretty barren,”
Reviews.Author: jkiddscot
Reviews.Content: +ve Though I stipulated a non-basement room I was given a below ground room - not a good arrival . however the basement is ground level at the back and the room had french windows. so was not at all that bad. -ve location; Statsholderskade - a dual carriageway south of the Amstel no bars no restuarants no shops within 400 metres opposite Dutch National Bank building one or two blemishes and the breakfast staff really do look like they hate their jobs! Summary Okay , good value, but you need to get the tram away from such a dead part of the city

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Ninking
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the adjusent Linda hotel, that was overbooked. So on our arrival we were moved to the Seasons. Overall, the hotel is nice - clean and compact. Tee/coffee and a tee pot make it homely. Reception stuff - friendly and helpful. Number of negative points: 1. Brekfast is basic, contains no vegetables or fruits. 2. Internet costs 5 â‚¬ per hour, and you can't get half an hour or less. But you may go across the corner and have a beer in a place with free interent. 3. The hotel is not in the center - it takes 10-15 min to get to the Rembrandts Square, and the same time - to the Museum Square . 4. The mattresses are veeeery soft - too soft for me.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat!!!....”
Reviews.Author: MrMoggles
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying in this hotel for 5 days, It was my birthday treat. We arrived on sunday and got there before check in and was allowed in the room, whatever hotel you stay in, in amsterdam you have to pay city tax. I would not say that its in the city centre, you can get a number 4 tram to the location of the hotel. The room was clean, small and compact, value for money. The beds are a little worn, could do with replacing, the decor was fresh and clean. The rooms have a kettle with tea and coffee. The breakfast was great, all fresh food and coffee. The hotel staff are very helpful. The hotel has WIFI it costs â‚¬5 for an hour â‚¬10 for 5 hours, you do the maths. All in all, the hotel was basic but clean, clean towels every day. A great little hotel, and yes I would go back. :-).....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.. loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: hol11
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple who stayed two nights at hotel seasons. It was very reasonable and upon arriving at the hotel the english speaking staff were very poilte and helpful, no fuss and waiting around for ages, in our rooms within 5 mins. Room was very spacious, nice view, lovely shower, comfy bed... very clean. Breakfast was lush, scrambled and boiled eggs, loads of cold meats,cheese's, cereal, fruit, orange and apple juice and chocolate milkshake too. Easiest was around the town is by tram, No 4. Over all we loved our stay and would def go back, only disapointing thing is that upon check in you have to pay city tax, which for us was around 10.00 euros, only bad thing as it wasnt stated when we booked it..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyBlue
Reviews.Content: For the price of three nights stay the hotel was brilliant!. The staff were helpful and friendly, the rooms were lovely and clean and very modern, the bathroom we had was lovely with bath and shower, my friends just had a shower but said it was just as lovely. And the beds were also very comfortable. You got coffee and tea in your room daily with clean mugs. There was secure parking for my car. There was a city tax when we arrived but as it was only 6 euros so we didn't mind and the location was perfect not too close to town but lots of bars, resturants and a supermarket close by, plus there was a pancake house round the corner which i would recommend to anyone, fantastic pancakes and waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Extra charges at check in.”
Reviews.Author: singletrack55
Reviews.Content: The price I paid online included tax. When I checked in I was charged for city taxes even though the room was prepaid, the prepayment online stated that tax was included. I brought this up to the desk again a few days later and they felt justified charging tax even when I should them the hotel my confirmation email that stated that tax was included. They were unwilling to fix this problem and admitted that other guests had been surprised by the charge. Its a shame this would be a nice hotel if they were honest about the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaraR93
Reviews.Content: Terrible Staff!! The manager who i speak with. Just didnâ€™t want to book any room, and didnâ€™t want to speak. So negative persone, i am shoked! I tell him, that i would like to speak with the hotel director, but he tell that he is the director and the owner of the hotel. It's not the lovely hotel, it is Negative Place.

Reviews.Title: “La La La Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: pixie013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seasons Hotel for a week and absolutely loved it! Iâ€™ll give you a break downâ€¦. CHECK IN â€“ The check-in was quick and painless. We had our keys and were in our rooms within 5 minutes. STAFF â€“ All of the staff were very friendly and helpful to us first timers. They were eager to suggest local hotspots and activities they thought we would enjoy. ROOMS â€“ The rooms are small but cozy. The furniture is modern and actually nicer than we were expecting after seeing some of the photos online. The shower is amazing, I wish mine at home was the same. The room has a large window and it is nice to sit and people watch. We had a room at the front of building so you can see the goings on on the street below. BREAKFAST â€“ We were a little worried that the continental breakfast wouldnâ€™t be very good but were pleasantly surprised. There was cereal, fruit, eggs, bread, cheese and meats. They even had sandwich makers, which we loved!! Our only issue was actually getting up on time to make it to breakfast. : ) LOCATION â€“ The hotel is located a little ways outside the centre of town. It is walking distance but after a day of walking around it is a bit tiring. We often took cabs which we felt were worth the money but most people found them expensive. There are also bike taxis that are fun to take but this is more expensive that taking a cab. There is also a nice market that was open on the weekend that had some really great deals and is just nice to check out. CHECK OUT - Again because we had pre-paid the check out was quick and painless. We had arranged the night before we left to have the shuttle take us to the airport and we were lucky to be the only ones on it as it would have a been a little crammed with more people. All in all we had an amazing trip and loved our stay at the Seasons Hotel. I would prefer to close to all the action but would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joybel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 3 day stay at the hotel Seasons. We requested a back room ( front rooms are a bit noisy apparently )and were shown to our room , it was well furnished, the beds are really comfortable and the room was clean. We had tea and coffee making equipment which was well received. The breakfast was very good plenty to eat and friendly obliging staff in the small restaurant. The Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and advice, We would stay at this hotel again . The trams run frequently from the corner of the street and are very cheap . It was nice to be that little bit out of the hustle and bustle of Dam Square and was no problem infact we were pleased of this. Amsterdam is great , go to the flower market . Anne Franks house is a must but please pre book on line as the queues can be really long , we were so glad that we had and you will be too believe me! We would say to pre book anything you want to do and can do on line to save the queues that you may have. You need good walking shoes and don't go thinking it will be restful but is a great city break.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: deauville3
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel to find th previous occupior had left a dirty coffee cup on the window sill. The room was supposed to be non-smoking but smelt of cigarette smoke and there was an ashtray on the desk. I pointed this out to the reception as we went out for a meal and was told some guests take an ashtry into their room???? When we returned the dirty cup was still there. Next morning we went out and on return the bathroom had a rather un savoury smell about it. The double room was two single beds pushed together. The windows open fully inwards but the safety catch has to be manually set in place. very dangerous. Despite the double glazed windos traffic noise was very loud as if the windows were a poor fit. Would definatly not recommend nor would I return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: dbeffa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 6 different cities in Europe on this trip, and this was by far the worst hotel. I was by myself but they gave me a "double" room. I'm not sure how two people would have fit in there. It also smelled like pot and was quite warm (in October!). With the window open, you could hear the busy street in front of the hotel. The location isn't bad, but it isn't great. It's walking distance (a long walk) to everything (there's a tram that runs a half block from the hotel, but I didn't use it). I picked it because it had parking. If you need parking, you'd better call ahead and make plans because their lot only holds about 4 cars. It is secured though. It costs 20 Euro a night, which seems expensive, but was in the ballpark of what I was paying on this trip. The worst part was that, the first night there, I lost my room key card (just one of the plastic magnetic ones). They charged me 10 Euro to replace it!!! I couldn't believe it. That's about 10% of the cost of the whole room! The mattress was thin and lumpy, and the tv would only show a clear picture for about 5 minutes. Then you'd have to turn it off for a few seconds and find your channel again. Overall, I was very unhappy. On the plus side, the staff spoke fluent English...but then, so does everyone in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and adorable”
Reviews.Author: LBloom
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and had the absolute best time. The breakfast was included (and well executed) and the room was small but comfortable. The mattress was excellent and the proximity to all the major attractions (about eight blocks from the museum district and three blocks from the Heinekin brewery : ) and the service was a bit erratic but very friendly. Very quiet after 9pm but expect noisy fellow travelers (the hallways are narrow and sound travels). Can be warm, find a fan if possible but the night breezes keep one pretty comfortable. Loved this place and we are returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: The locatin of this hotel is right on the southern edge of where the touristy things are, not great, but not bad for the price. Five blocks from Rembrandt Plein, four long blocks from the Leides Plein and right on the tram route. Our first room was small, hot and loud. The hotel sits on one of the very busy streets and if you are in the front it sounds like trucks and scooters are driving through your room. Make sure you get a room on the upper floors and in the rear. Our second room was on the fourth floor, in the rear, and it was fine. There are many good restaurants and pubs within a few minutes walk. Central Station is a 10 to 15 min tram ride. The beds are somewhat hard, but passable. The front desk is friendly but they knew less about the city than I did. The breakfast was great. The elevator is so slow we walked the stairs. If you're looking for an inexpensive place to stay that is clean and not too far out, this one is fine. I am not particular about hotels when I'm in Europe,but this one is at the lower end of my acceptable range.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: slavinder
Reviews.Content: Online stated have double beds but when we got there found out they were twin. Staff were not particularly friendly. The bath had a really high side which even i (who have no impairments) had trouble getting in and out of - this was also the only way to shower. Breakfasts were nice, continental spread. Room was quite small but served its purpose. I felt for the cost is was not central enough for us but if you prefer quieter suburbs then this is better for that. our view from the room was of a roof that looked like builders had been having a party on there! empty cans and tools/equipment left out. Allin all distinctly average but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel facilites quite nice, staff not...”
Reviews.Author: n3no
Reviews.Content: I've recently spent 4 nights at Hotel Seasons. For a 3 star hotel the accomodation is quite nice. Nice beds, good spaced rooms, 10 minutes walk from center and 1 minute walk from Albert Huip (can't remember if it is spelled right=) market. But I'm afraid we had bad luck with staff. After first night the room was cleaned ok and beds made. After second night beds made but no cleaning of coffee cups and garbage can. On the third night coffe cups and garbage still unclean but what's worse on it they didn't do our beds, so our room had no cleaning service for our last night. We always woke up at 9 so they had plenty of time. Another odd thing is that they made me pay for the accomodation on the check in. This was the only hotel where this happened to me on arrival and not on check out. After that, I asked in the front desk where could I put my stamped postcards and the man offered to put it for me. After 1 month postcards weren't delivered. With 1,5 Euro stamp they should have been deliverd in 4-5 days...not. On our way out we are sure we have forgotten a bag with souvenir on the front desk. After telephoning to the reception they denied...I would love to believe him...but after some dissapointment with all I can't. And don't ask them to call for a taxi for your to the airport. They'll charge extra 12â‚¬ for it. Look directly in advance for TCA taxis and arrange it for yourself. They have fixed rates, speak english and are polite. =) I still have to say that breakfast was ok as well as ladies helping and serving during breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: chazza1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel seasons for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it, the rooms were clean and modern, would definately recommend this hotel, there is a quite a walk into the town centre but a tram is located just outside and run requently, would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convinient but expensive”
Reviews.Author: amethyst2700
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two night stay at the Seasons Hotel Amsterdam and would rate it as 'OK'. Were very impressed that our room was ready for check-in at 10am rather than the 2pm specified. After a very early flight from London this was appreciated. The room was clean and tidy but quite small. Amenities include an in-room safe, tea and coffee making facilities and an en-suit bathroom, but no in-room fridge. There is a vending machine in the foyer, and an internet terminal you can use with a pre-purchased card, but no room service or mini-bar facilities. If you require a supermarket, there is one about 100m away from the hotel. When you exit the hotel turn left, cross over the intersection and the supermarket is further along on the left hand side. The rooms themselves are quite small. Neither I nor my partner are tall people however both of us had to duck to use the bathroom, particularly the shower. Be careful also as the shower curtain is highly inadequate and the shower can easily flood the bathroom. The included breakfast was adequate and included cereals, breads, cold meats and cheese. The service from the hotel was fine, but nothing really special. Location wise the hotel is great. Walking distance from the museums, Heineken Experience and botanical gardens. Two trams run past the hotel and can take you to Dam Square and Central Station in 10 mins. From either of these places you can change trams to go to the Anne Frank House or simply walk from Dam Square in about 7 mins. TIP: Take the number 4 or 25 from Central Station to the Hotel, getting off the stop after Fredreiksplein. TIP: Amsterdam is expensive. Trams are Euro 1.60 per trip, or you can buy a 7 trip card for Euro 4.50. Even better if you think you will catch them a lot is the 24 hour card for Euro 6.50. Multi trip cards can not be bought from the tram driver, only ticket sellers such as the Tourist Information Centre outside Central Station. Recommend you get one before you head off to your hotel. Overall the hotel was fine. Nothing special but nothing worth complaining about. The location is not great for restaurants or a quick dinner but with the trams so convenient you can always jump into town and grab something.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: grantos3000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my first trip to Amsterdam in December 2006. In general, the accommodation was good, but for what you got I found it very overpriced. The rooms were clean and bathrooms modern, however a lack of an adequate shower curtain meant the whole bathroom got soaked everytime you used the shower (some rooms have proper shower cubicles - it is luck of the draw!). Each room had a flat screen TV which played some english channels which make a change to the usual foreign hotel TV. Hotel was easy to find and about 10 minutes tram ride to central station/damm Square. Staff were very friendly and helpful. This would have been an excellent hotel for my short stay had it not been for the price. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Bad”
Reviews.Author: Alexandrapovinski
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Seasons hotel for 3nights in mid august for my 21st birthday. Nice hotel, pleasant looking inside and out, we had a nice sized room, comfortable. Good view over the canal. The first night we went into a local bar to have a few drinks, but my girlfriend at the stroke of midnight said happy birthday a little too loud and the owner and locals heard. They had us dancing on the tables, they were a lot of fun and very welcoming. They even showed us how to play billiards which is quite hard but a lot of fun, as far as I can remember the bar was called Buudrum or something, if you turn left out of the hotel, and left again it is about 250mtrs up the road. Good way to see in your birthday. The night of my birthday we went to the red light to go and see a stripper as a treat. The red light district doesnt do strippers any more its all peep shows which are a bit vile for us, but we did find the 'Moulin Rouge' it was a series of shows which were filthy but a bit comical, they definitely put on a show anyway. So if your going to see those things prepare to be a bit shocked and also laugh. Overall great holiday and way to celebrate a birthday, and the hotel just made it better.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Locationally”
Reviews.Author: Jonny_Casey
Reviews.Content: This a decent hotel in an ideal location. 10 minutes walk from the city centre, you are away from the hustle and bustle but still in the heart of the city, just a few hundred meters from the Heineken Experience (which I HIGHLY recomend!), the other museums and Vondel Park. There is also an enourmous flea market on the street behind and a canal at your doorstep. The Hotel was modern, clean, great simple breakfast and very helpful staff. The rooms are small but big enough and have tea/coffee and a kettle provided, as well as a flat-screen TV! (with both Dutch and British channels) For the price you'd do well to beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bait and switch!”
Reviews.Author: adnelg
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had booked a one-night stay at the Seasons at the conclusion of our Amsterdam trip -- we wanted to stay right in the city, and particularly in the area where the Seasons was located. It took us a lot of research to settle on this particular hotel, and we were very happy when we found a good price on an internet seller. Upon arrival at the hotel at 11 am, we were told to leave our bags until 2, which was fine -- off we went to the nearby Van Gogh museum. Upon returning at 2, we were told that they were overbooked and we were being transferred to their sister hotel in the red light district -- not at all where I wanted to stay, and it was a one star! After much debate, we were told that we could look at their other property, the Hotel Linda next door. No jokes, there were bloodstains on the wall above the bed and bugs crawling all over the mattress. We returned and told the manager that there was no way we could accept either of these transfers. I must say, he was very helpful, letting us use the phone and store our luggage as we worked out alternate stay arrangements. In addition, I should mention that the internet company promptly refunded our money. The reason why I chose to post this review, despite not having actually stayed at the hotel, was because I was struck by the manager's comment during our discussion. He stated, "Whenever this happens, people are happy to accept the transfer." I said, "This happens frequently?" He replied, "We always overbook to ensure we are full." So take this as you will, but it certainly sounds as though this is not an isolated incident.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a 'triple superior' at this hotel (room 202) with two friends. Although we were disappointed at the small size of the room, it was nevertheless functional. However, all three of us awoke on the second (and mercifully final) morning of our stay covered in large red welts, none of which had been there the previous evening. We can only assume that the beds were crawling with bugs. Unfortunately we had to depart quite early, and didn't really notice the bites until we had already left, and were therefore unable to take the matter up with hotel management. I have since emailed the hotel, but have received no response. If you would like to stay in a dirty, poorly managed hotel, I can heartily recommend Hotel Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “well positoned hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: daz05
Reviews.Content: 19thmay- 22nd may reviewer shirley portsmouth We visited Amsterdam for my husbands birthday, with some friends.We found the seasons hotel to be very comfortable with good service from the chiense owners.Our room was on the first floor,only problem was that the rooms are not very soundproof and being by the stairs some noise was encoutered The hotel was well postioned for an easy walk into the main part of the city.As the weather was poor we used the canal bus a lot and found this a good way to see the city. Resturant wise we would recomend a visit to the Tujuh Maret in utechtsestraat for an excellant indonesian meal.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag, watch you step.”
Reviews.Author: Savnterer
Reviews.Content: This is our experience with the hotel: --- We changed our schedule to arrive one day later than it had been booked. The hotel changed the reservation without penalty (with more than 24hrs warning.) We had to change rooms twice because of the poor quality of the rooms. When we arrived at 9 am with check-in time being 2pm, it took some effort to be allowed to leave our luggage until check-in time. The desk clerk flatly advised us to come back not earlier than 2pm. Our documents folder, which we left for 5 minutes on the front desk barrier, with copies of our passports and itineraries, was found by us in the hands of strangers in the lobby. The strangers were eagerly reading our papers. The twin room which was assigned to us first, number 405, has little in common with pictures provided on the hotel's Web site: it was small, claustrophobic, with a window, which could not be closed in principle. There was only one bed stand, placed in such a manner, that its drawer could not be opened due to smallness of the room. Next morning we asked for a different room. Our request was granted with the room 107, which was of a decent size. However, its storm window was broken, so that it could not be open reliably. Immediately beneath the window there was the roof of the breakfast area. The roof was covered with garbage. The window did not have a mosquito screen, so when the window was opened (precariously), the room was filled with mosquitos (which were flying inside the hallway as well.) Our sleep was disturbed not only by mosquitoes, but also by a loud TV in the adjacent room, used, obviously, by the night staff. It took tapping on the wall to make them make TV less loud. Next morning we requested yet a different room, and get the room 307 of the same size as the room 107. While waiting at the front desk, we heard departing guests expressing their dissatisfaction with their rooms. The 307's window (storm type) could be opened more reliably, but it did not have a mosquitoe screen - again, so the mosquitoes remained a problem, though less prominent than before. (The hotel does not have A/C, so to open the window is necessary.) The cleaning crew did not bother to dust off the surfaces, and the windowsill was dirty. The bathroom was new and clean, with ventilation working permanently. However, in order to get into the bath tub to get a shower, one has to step over tub wall which is about 25 inch high (64 cm). This might be quite difficult for some people, especially in the bathroom, where a fall might be quite traumatic. The cleaning staff was sometimes very loud, even with "Do not disturb sign" displayed outside the room. I am attaching pictures of room 405 and of waht was outside the window of the room 107.

Reviews.Title: “A real success”
Reviews.Author: SCSCheshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seasons from the 4th until the 7th May 2006. I had spent a long time researching affordable accomodation and because of the good reviews this hotel received I decided to book it. We were not disappointed. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good and the bathroom and bedroom were very nice, with a lovely comfy bed. Our flight home wasn't until evening and we were able to leave our luggage locked up at the hotel after we had checked out. I was a little anxious about the location of the hotel but we found it easy to walk to all the major locations within about 20 minutes. There are no pictures of the outside of the hotel, but it is a very nice looking dutch house and just accross the road, at the front, there is a canal which was a pleasant surprise. Overall we had a fantastic weekend and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. l

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but beware of credit card charge”
Reviews.Author: Marble_girl
Reviews.Content: To get to the hotel you can take tram 4 or 25 from Central Station and you just tell the driver you are going to 'Stadhouderskade' and he will stamp your strip ticket (we bought the tickets from the newsagent as the ticket machine was not working). When we arrived at the hotel we were warmly greeted, and even though it was 14.30 we were unable to check into our room because it was not ready. I asked if it was possible for us to leave our baggage and check in everything later but were assured that it wouldn't take too long. We waited for about 20 minutes, which seemed long considering we were only going to be in Amsterdam for less than three days. I decided to pay during check in and was told that using a credit card would incur a 3% charge. I offered to pay using my Maestro but was told this was not acceptable even though I told them that this was a debit card. It wasn't until after my bill had been processed that the mention of Cirrus (which my card was also) could also be used, but by then it was too late - so a bit annoyed about that. We were given a room in the basement. It was a nicely decorated room and clean. The beds were comfy but really sagged in the middle so when my partner and I slept in the bed later that evening we both ended up rolling towards each other into the centre. The bathroom was nice and clean too and the room had a hairdryer which was good (although a little noisy). Breakfast was decent. There were a variety of cold meat slices, cheese and bread, and the waitresses would serve you tea and coffee. There was also cereals, variety of jams, tinned fruit salad, and apple/ orange juice. Walking into the centre of town takes about 20 mins probably less if you walk fast. There is also a Lidl situated about 5mins to the right of the hotel as you come out of the hotel, and about 5mins to your right there is an Albert Heijn.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Flowerfairy
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to Amsterdam from Sat 22nd April for three days and we stayed at The Seasons Hotel because of the reviews I had read - It really was a nice hotel. We had a twin room which was fairly small but adequate, decorated in an oriental style- having white bedlinen with lavender cushions and bed runners , a lot of thought has gone into decorating the rooms - even the kettle was lavender coloured ! A smart and clean bathroom-I did have a bit of trouble with the taps over the bath. The 'hot' tap is actually a temperature gauge only and the 'cold' tap is for water flow. The reception staff were friendly and helpful explaining where I was going wrong when I thought we had no water coming out of the hot tap- Oops . Breakfast was simple but good. We found the tram service No.25 and No.4 really good for getting around and we never had to wait longer than a few minutes for it. We hope you enjoy your trip to Amsterdam and The Seasons Hotel as much as we did. p.s. A visit to the Kerkenhoff gardens is a must see from March to May. Just get a train from the Central Station in Amsterdam to Leiden (around EUR 13.00 return) then get the Kerkenhoff Gardens bus No. 54 which takes you straight there. A combination return bus ticket and entrance to the gardens costs EUR 17.00 which you buy at the Conexxions desk just outside the station. Its absolutely beautiful. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Seasons Hotel for a weekend getaway. The room we stayed in was on the second floor and although was a little small, it was comfortable, nicely decorated and clean. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helped us arrange an evening canal cruise. The buffet breakfast was good with juices, breads, cold meats, fruit and cereals. The hotel is in a great location and made it very easy to get into the city centre by tram. The number 4 or 25 tram, which run frequently (we never waited more than 5mins) from central station takes you straight from the central station to the hotel. Overall, a great hotel for a getaway to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “loved the breakfast and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my partner travelled to seasons hotel on the 13th feb for a few days when we arrived it was jate in the evening but we had no problems getting into the hotel we decided to take the train from schpol airport and then the number 24 tram which to us directly to the hotel the staff were very freindly. the room was v clean and the bathroom was also nice warm and clean. the rates for the hotel were excellent as we kinda booked at the last minute,the hotel was not to far away from the main attractions. we use to buy a day ticket for around 6 euros each were we could travell on all trams and metro for a whole 24hours. we looked forward to the breakfast as the the two ladies that served us each morning were always eager to help theres alot of variety food wise. just around the corner a a huge market selling everything imaginable. we had a great time and are looking forward to are next visit. the center of amsterdam really comes alive at night i definately reccommend amsterdam, the little boutique were just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Anoop22mUK
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend booked last minute and got the room at very reasonable prices for 2 nights stay. We arrived to a very friendly desk, just 5 minutes on tram route 4 or 25 which can be cought anywhere along the dam sqaure route costing only 1 euro 60 from centraal station or the hotel. The hotel faces the dutch national bank and opposite a river and is in a very friendly area with good access to all areas of amsterdam but not having to tolerate the hustle and bustle of inner city amsterdam. We arrived around 2pm and the hotel receptionist greeted us with warm smiled and asked us what room we would like, we chose double and he gave us the option of rooms and floors before we chose each room, each room is decorated similarly with 23" LCD tv's in each room, plush bed and leather seating with cushioned head board which is very comfy with either the choice of rooms from double bed to two single's in the twin with very comfy bed's esspecially after lounging around amsterdam all day to return to such warm and high ceilinged rooms and a very powerful two person shower and all en suite rooms have a free electronic safe in them and views of either the rear terrace or the canal to the front and all rooms can be accesed easily via the lift. Also rooms have tea and coffee making facilities and telephones. Rooms are cleaned daily and to the highest standard including air fresheners in rooms which is a nice touch. Walls and windows are also very well soundproofed too. breakfast is served daily with a choice of cereals and toasted sandwiches and cheeses and jams and ham and salami whilst the waiteresses serve fresh tea and coffee to your table. It is worth mentioning that you are asked to pay the bill upon leaving so make sure you ask to pay before should you choose to. All staff speak excellent english and there is a lidl 100 yards down the road and an amazing bar and grill which is family friendly to all which is open to all until around 3am which is also just around the corner. we enjoyed our stay so much that we have already booked again for several week's time we enjoyed in amsterdam so much! we hope you choose this hotel as we were glad we chose the hotel. i have stayed in the hilton hotel and sheraton hotel resort range and they are of 4 and 5 star standard but this hotel in terms of facilites and service and quality of room furnishings is definitely a 4 star and not a 5 star esspecially as there is a classy sauna and beauty parlour just several door's down.

HotelInfo.Name: Seasons Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Stadhouderskade 135, Amsterdam 1074 AZ, The Netherlands
